title.narrative: Participator y planning for action and change. Participatory planning for action and change

description.narrative: Asociación Folklórica Alo Paraguaieté (AFAP), $50,000 over 18 months; counterpart committed, $46,635 AFAP will improve its planning, managerial and operational capacities and that of its 13 member organizations. It will work closely with its members to advocate for their rights under Paraguayan law and community development priorities before local and regional government organizations. The grant will benefit approximately 165 members of the. Entidad Socio Cultural Alo Paraguaiete (ESCAP). AFAP will improve its planning, managerial and operational capacities and that of its 13 member organizations. It will work closely with its members to advocate for their rights under Paraguayan law and community development priorities before local and regional government organizations. The grant will benefit approximately 165 members of the Association directly and 1500 individuals indirectly.. It will work closely with its members to advocate for their rights under Paraguayan law and community development priorities before local and regional government organizations. The grant will benefit approximately 165 members of the Association directly and 1500 individuals indirectly.

mailing-address.narrative: 1331 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Suite 1200 NorthÂ Washington, DC 20004

description.narrative: The Government of Paraguay is making significant advances in fighting corruption and impunity and eradicating extreme poverty. Encouraged by a recently approved Freedom of Information Law and widely available public notices, citizens are denouncing irregularities and sending a clear message that corruption will not be tolerated. Although high levels of income inequality remain, Paraguayan government programs are producing positive results in reducing poverty and in countering illicit activities in the northern region. U.S. assistance programs add momentum to these positive developments, helping Paraguay strengthen its democratic institutions and supporting more equitable and environmentally sustainable economic growth.
